DataElement.preferredName: Performance Status Preoperative Assessment ECOG Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Score based on the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) scale representing the functional capabilities of a person immediately before a surgical operation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities._Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation. :Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/14/20 jk Upd RD to "Qualified"; CPTAC released AI.  11/20/19 jk created for CPTAC baseline CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The level of patient function scored using the modified ECOG performance status criteria._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

PermissibleValues.value: Unknown: Could not be determined or unsure

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication that something is indeterminate or unknown.

Concepts.definition: An indication that something is indeterminate or unknown.

PermissibleValues.value: Not Evaluated: Not provided or available

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The desired information is not available.

Concepts.definition: The desired information is not available.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

Concepts.definition: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light housework, office work.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light housework, office work.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

Concepts.definition: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

Concepts.definition: Ambulatory and capable of all self care but unable to carry out any work activities. Up and about more than 50% of waking hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

Concepts.definition: Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

Concepts.definition: Completely disabled. Cannot carry on any selfcare. Totally confined to bed or chair.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added OBIB alternate name and identifier DWQ 03-21-2019

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
